text: Acleris obtusana, the small aspen leaftier moth, is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is found in Norway, Sweden, Finland, Estonia and Latvia.Fauna Europaea It is also found in Russia and North America, where it has been recorded from Alberta, Indiana, Maine, Michigan, Montana, New Hampshire, New York, Ontario, Vermont and Wisconsin.mothphotographersgroup The wingspan is 15–19 mm. Adults are on wing from August to May. The larvae feed on Populus species (including Populus alba, Populus grandidentata, Populus tremuloides), Alnus incana, Betula papyrifera and Salix species.Tortricidae Food Plant Database ==References== ==Further reading== * Category:Moths described in 1844 obtusana Category:Moths of Europe Category:Moths of Russia Category:Moths of North America
title: Acleris obtusana
